intro: Uragoga lasiostylis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of the family. Uragoga lasiostylis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
